>

al he was recieving was strange. It was not a
> communication in the conven=
tional sense. It was a resonance wave that
> was traveling along the backro=
und energy that was in this strange
> jungle. Like a small leaf floating al=
ong a larger river, the signal
> went out riding on the wave of energy that=
 seemed to permeate this
> section of jungle. It was detectable by WHEELIE'=
s communication gear
> but it was not being transmitted along the typical l=
ines.

having

=

would have recieved it had they been with WHEELIE, but it was

MUS was smart, but he

n skills,

<NEW - WHEELIE>

OOC - NICE post Preston.  Nice=
 little reminders you put in. ;)

At this point, WHEELIE would realize that=
 he had lost contact over with the ARK and hte other AUtobot forces, in his=
 haste to extricate himself from it and go in search of his friend.  Now he=
 would be disrupting their own search by making them also look for him as w=
ell.  

Wheelie shook his head as he realized his own haste in things would=
 now compound the issue in searching.  But he would deal with that later.

=
At this point, Wheelie was confused by what he was detecting, and he had to=
 take a few moments to try and recalibrate his scanners.  It was foreign to=
 him, and he was not very well versed over in communications.  As the memor=
ies of Rodimus current status, he shook his head.  He had been wrong and mi=
santicipated hwat he was looking for.

WHEELIE had not heard much (if at al=
l) on teh crashed ship and prisoners, having only been peripherally paying =
attention during the earlier briefing when it had been on before his fight =
had been instigated, so he was mostly unaware of any signs that could be of=
 them.

For the moment, what he could tell was that the signal was made by =
an Autobot, but it could be anything, and anyone with reasonable skill coul=
 ddo such a thing, at least to his minimal skill level with sensors.

As he=
 also recalibrated his sensors, and he realized next that RODIMUS did not h=
ave this level of skill, his frown deepened.  WHo woudl ahve the capacity t=
o send out a flickering signal along AUTOBOT lines, if not the Predacons?  =
But why would they bother with such a thing?

And yet, having little else h=
e could go on now he went over in that direction.  Assuming the ground was =
in good enough shape to allow him to transform and make better speed, he ou=
ld do so.  If not, he would walk.
